bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 48 (Monday, March 18, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. FRANKEL:H.R. 1820.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H2755]

item.title: United States-Israel Cooperation Enhancement and Regional Security Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

summary.text:
United States-Israel International Development Cooperation Act of 2019

This bill authorizes projects among the United States, Israel, and developing countries to support local solutions to sustainability challenges relating to water resources, agriculture, and energy storage.

The U.S. Agency for International Development may enter into a memorandum of understanding with Israel to work together toward common goals in areas such as energy, agriculture, democracy, human rights, economic growth, and education.

bill.title: United States-Israel International Development Cooperation Act of 2019

item.title: United States-Israel International Development Cooperation Act of 2019
To authorize appropriations for certain cooperative projects among the United States, Israel, and developing countries, and for other purposes.
United States-Israel International Development Cooperation Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
